newsitem.title: ESTONIA: KAUBAMAJA H1 PROFIT 20 PCT HIGHER THAN ESTIMATE.
newsitem.headline: KAUBAMAJA H1 PROFIT 20 PCT HIGHER THAN ESTIMATE.

text.p: Tallinna Kaubamaja , a department store, said on Thursday its half-year profit was 20 percent higher than it previously expected.
Tallinna Kaubamaja has no plans to raise its 1997 profit forecast so far and has not discussed it, the company's board member Urmo Vallner told Reuters.
Its consolidated profit before taxes was 17.7 million kroons after six months. Its net profit estimate was 34 million kroons for the whole year.
Vallner added that the store earns most of its profits before Christmas.
The profit of the main store was higher than the consolidated profit figure by 2.4 million kroons, which was due to the launch of two subsidiaries, Vallner said.
In April it opened a department store in Helsinki and it will launch a seven-storey car park in Tallinn centre in the autumn, he said.
